'Anguilla' ( ) is a British overseas territory in the Caribbean. It is one of the most northerly of the
Leeward Islands in the Lesser Antilles, lying east of Puerto Rico and the Virgin
Islands and directly north of Saint Martin. The territory consists of the main
island of Anguilla itself, approximately 16 miles (26 km) long by 3 miles
(5 km) wide at its widest point, together with a number of much smaller
islands and cays with no permanent population. The island's capital is The
Valley. The total land area of the territory is 35 square miles
(90 km 2), with a population of
approximately 13,500 (2006 estimate).

Anguilla has become a popular tax haven, having no capital gains, estate, profit
or other forms of direct taxation on either individuals or
corporations. In April 2011, faced with a mounting deficit, it
introduced a 3% "Interim Stabilisation Levy", Anguilla's first form of income
tax.
categories: Special territories of the European Union
